title: Asia stocks firm as Fed props up rate cut expectations
text: Asian stocks advanced on Friday after a top Federal Reserve official cemented expectations of a U.S. interest rate cut later this month, fuelling appetite for riskier assets and keeping a cap on the dollar.

title: Exclusive: IEA revising oil demand growth forecast down on slowing economy
text: The International Energy Agency (IEA) is reducing its 2019 oil demand forecast due to a slowing global economy amid a U.S.-China trade spat, its executive director said on Thursday.

title: U.S.-China officials discuss trade; Mnuchin eyes possible in-person talks
text: U.S. and Chinese officials spoke by telephone on Thursday as the world's two largest economies seek to end a year-long trade war, with U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin suggesting in-person  talks could follow.

title: China makes biggest U.S. sorghum purchase since April as trade talks resume
text: China made its biggest purchase of U.S. sorghum since April last week, according to U.S.

title: Oil rises after US Navy destroys Iranian drone
text: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Friday after the U.S. Navy destroyed an Iranian drone in the Strait of Hormuz, a major chokepoint for global crude flows, again raising tensions in the Middle East.

title: Asia stocks gain, dollar sags as Fed reinforces rate cut expectations
text: Asian stocks gained and the dollar sagged on Friday after a top Federal Reserve official all but cemented expectations of a U.S. interest rate cut later this month.

title: Exclusive: WeWork to host Wall Street analyst day in IPO push - sources
text: The We Company, parent of flexible workspace operator WeWork, plans to host an analyst day for Wall Street banks on July 31, as the company steps up its preparations for an initial public offering (IPO), people familiar with the matter said.

title: Cramer: Don't mess around with pre-market trading during earnings season

title: Wall Street rises as Fed's Williams cements rate-cut expectations
text: U.S. stocks moved higher on Thursday after a slow start as comments from New York Fed President John Williams helped cement expectations for an interest rate cut from the U.S. central bank at the end of the month.

title: Stocks gain on Fed rate cut optimism; oil drops
text: A gauge of global stocks advanced on Thursday, erasing declines on a late rally after comments from a U.S. Federal Reserve policymaker heightened expectations for a rate cut, while oil prices dropped on forecasts of rising output.

text: Spiking tensions in the Gulf of Oman and rising oil production in the U.S. are combining to put crude prices in a difficult position, says RBC's Helima Croft.

title: Dow Jones Today: An Impressive Comeback
text: Even with some trouble spots, the Nasdaq Composite, of which Netflix is a member, gained 0.27% while the S&P 500 added 0.36%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.01%.

title: Stocks snap losing skid as Fed official hints that central bank may lower rates aggressively
text: U.S. equity benchmarks finished the session mostly higher Thursday after Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said the central bank needs to act quickly to quash signs of economic weakness.

title: Wall Street rises as Fed's Williams bolsters rate-cut hopes

title: Now the market thinks the Fed could make an even deeper cut to rates later this month
text: The fact that interest rates are relatively low makes the idea of a so-called insurance rate cut later this month an attractive option for the Fed.

title: Oil falls about 2.5% as U.S. Gulf production returns
text: Oil fell about 2.5% a barrel on Thursday, weighed down by weakness in U.S. equities markets and an expectation that crude output would rise in the Gulf of Mexico following last week's hurricane in the region.

title: Traders see 50% chance of half-point rate cut in July after Fed's Williams remarks
text: Traders in the fed funds futures market now expect a more than 50% chance of a 50 basis point rate cut by the Federal Reserve at its July 30-31 meeting, following the release of prepared remarks from New York Fed President John Williams.

title: Debt Ceiling Crisis: Here We Go Again?
text: In the next couple of months, likely in September, the U.S. government will run out of money and won't have the funds to pay its bills.

title: Fed member predicts US-China trade deal won't end uncertainties
text: St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank President James Bullard says that volatility from trade uncertainty won't end even if the US makes a trade deal with China.
